column4: hey ppl, i just installed ubuntu and im trying to apply a gtk2 theme but it doesnt work properly... what could it be??
theme engine not installed
could be one thing
do you know what packed is that? i installed everything related :P
are there instructions that came with the theme?
not really.. i put the themes in the correct folder... they appear in gtk-theme-switch2 list
yes, but they sometimes require engines to run properly
is there a readme or something?
ill take a look.. 1 of them had no readme file or anything like that... maybe the other :X
quite possible. I know it's happened to me a few times
no readme :P
do you remember where you got it?
there is a metacity folder and a gtk2.0 folder... with no readme inside
do you remember where you got it?
yes... gnome-look in the gtk2.0 theme section
go back and see if there is anything indicating anything there
well none of the themes work properly... maybe its something more general :X
have you tried logging out and then back in?
yes... twice
do i need to restart or just relog in X?
try restarting X, and then if that doesn't work, then I dunno what to tell you. I usually don't use gnome, but when I do, that's what my problem usually is (damn theme engines)

hey i found out something... when i try to change to any downloaded theme using gtk-chtheme, terminal shows the following message: /usr/share/themes/Shiftie_Black/gtk-2.0/gtkrc:1719: error: unexpected character `{', expected character `='
try fixing that, and see where it gets you
